info.title: Egress from Dwelling Units
info.subtitle: Volume II - 9.9.9.
info.description: Location and distances of exits from living spaces in a building

1_9_9_9_1.sectionTitle: 9.9.9.1. Travel limit to Exits or Egress Doors

P2.questionText: How many <defined-term override-term='storey'>storeys</defined-term> does this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have?
P2.questionSubtext: This tool will evaluate the means of egress from individual dwelling units, until advised otherwise, please evaluate all answers based on a single dwelling unit within the <defined-term>building</defined-term>.

P3.questionText: Which of the following <defined-term override-term='storey'>storeys</defined-term> within the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have an egress or <defined-term>exit</defined-term> doors on that storey?

P5.questionText: Which level(s) with greater than 1 storey of travel to an <defined-term>exit</defined-term> of the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have access to a balcony on that level?

P6.questionText: Is this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> above another dwelling unit?

P7.questionText: Which level(s) of the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have access to an openable window that is at least 1m high and 0.55m wide at that level?

P8.questionText: On which level(s) is the window less than 1m above the finish floor level and less than 7m above adjacent ground level?

P9.questionText: On which level(s) is the door an egress door to a <defined-term>public corridor</defined-term>, enclosed <defined-term>exit</defined-term> stair, or passageway?

P10.questionText: On which level(s) is the egress door an <defined-term>exit</defined-term> doorway that is not more than 1.5m above adjacent ground level?

P11.questionText: Are there more than 2 <defined-term override-term='dwelling unit'>dwelling units</defined-term> in this <defined-term>building</defined-term>?

P12.questionText: Is this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> provided with at least two separate <defined-term>means of egress</defined-term>?

P13.questionText: Does this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term>’s egress door open onto a <defined-term>public corridor</defined-term> or an exterior passageway?

P14.questionText: Where the egress door opens onto the corridor or exterior passageway, is it possible to go in opposite directions to 2 separate <defined-term override-term='exit'>exits</defined-term>?

P15.questionText: Does the egress door of this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> open onto a corridor that meets the requirements of <pdf-download-link number='99731' named-dest='9.9.7.3. Dead-End Corridors'>Sentence 9.9.7.3.(1)</pdf-download-link>?

P17.questionText: Does this <defined-term>building</defined-term> meet the definition of a <defined-term>secondary suite</defined-term>?

P18.questionText: Does this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have separate and direct access to the balcony(s) on level(s): <answer-value answer='P5'></answer-value>?

P19.questionText: Does this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have separate and direct access to openable window(s) on level(s): <answer-value answer='P8'></answer-value>?

P20.questionText: Is this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> located above another <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> or common space?

P21.questionText: Does the egress door of this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> open onto a shared egress facility (corridor, passageway, stair, <defined-term>ramp</defined-term>, etc.) that is served by a single stair or <defined-term>ramp</defined-term>?

P22.questionText: Does the egress door of this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> open onto an <defined-term>exit</defined-term> stair, <defined-term>public corridor</defined-term>, exterior passageway, or balcony, that serves more than one <defined-term>suite</defined-term>?

P23.questionText: The egress door of the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> opens onto ...

P24.questionText: Is the <defined-term>public corridor</defined-term> served by a single <defined-term>exit</defined-term>?

P25.questionText: Is the <answer-value answer='P23'></answer-value> served by a single <defined-term>exit</defined-term> stairway or <defined-term>ramp</defined-term>?

P26.questionText: Is the <answer-value answer='P23'></answer-value> no more than 1.5m above adjacent ground level?

P28.questionText: Based on the provided building characteristics the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> must be provided with the items listed below to meet the provisions of the BC Building Code 2024. Are these provided for this dwelling unit?
P28.questionSubtext:
• an exterior passageway that has a floor assembly with a fire-resistance rating less than 45 min
  • be served by a single exit stairway or ramp
  • be located more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level

R1_1.resultDisplayMessage: Based on your selections the height of this dwelling unit exceeds the maximum height of the building and the maximum height permitted for a Part 9 Building. Based on this the building can not be newly constructed to Part 9 of the BC Building Code. Please review your selections for error, if the height of the building exceeds 3 storeys the building will need to be designed in accordance with Parts 3, 4, 5, and 6 in place of Part 9. This tool only evaluates the Building Code compliance of buildings designed in accordance with Part 9 of the BC Building Code 2024, if there are no errors in your selections, please contact the appropriate required design professionals for this building.

R1_2.resultDisplayMessage: Based on your selections this <defined-term>building</defined-term> does not comply with the BC Building Code 2024 as this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> is not provided with a Building Code Compliant means of egress.

R1_3.resultDisplayMessage: The evaluated <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> has been deemed to satisfy all requirements of Subsection 9.9.9. of the Building Code. If there are additional dwelling units within this <defined-term>building</defined-term> that have not had their means of egress evaluated for compliance with the BC Building Code 2024 click "Start Over" below.
